data.name: About_Index_Par1
data.value: This software was created during the ACCEPT Project. ACCEPT is a Collaborative Project – STREP aimed at developing new methods and techniques to make machine translation (MT) work better in the environment characterised by internet communities sharing specific information.

data.name: About_Index_Par2
data.value: Today, anyone can in principle create information and make it available to anyone in the world with internet access. Yet the language barrier remains: however accessible information is, it is still only available to those who speak the language it is written in. ACCEPT’s mission is to help communities share information more effectively across the language barrier, by improving the quality of machine-translated community content.

data.name: About_Index_Par3
data.value: Want to know more about it ?

data.name: Account_UserProfile_NoAppsPar1
data.value: In order to use the ACCEPT plug-in you will need an API Key. To get an API key, click in the "Create Application" button.

data.name: BrowserCompMessage
data.value: Our system has been tested on the following supported browsers: Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0+, Mozilla Firefox 11.0+, Google Chrome 21.0+ and Safari 5.1+.

data.name: Demo_ExplanationText_Par1
data.value: This Demo shows how we have integrated our ACCEPT text checking application in a Web-based editor (TinyMCE). This editor has a lot of functionality, most of which is not relevant for the purpose of this demonstration. The main feature of this editor is the green ACCEPT button, which triggers a spelling, grammar and style check on the text typed or pasted in the text area.

data.name: Demo_ExplanationText_Par2
data.value: Once your text is checked, results will be displayed in a pop-up window where potential spelling, grammar or stylistic problems will be underlined. In simple cases, hovering over an underlined word will bring up suggestions, which you may decide to use to improve your text. In more complex cases, suggestions will not be available and you will have the possibility to read the advice (in the tooltips) and decide whether you want to make any changes in the text area itself. At any time, you can replace your original text with the pop-up text by clicking “Apply”. Enjoy your checks!

data.name: Demo_Index_PlugInDemonstrations_ParOne
data.value: The ACCEPT plugin can be used to improve the quality of text entered by your users. It provides several capabilities including spelling, grammar and style corrections. The plugin has been designed so that it can be integrated into any Web based application with a minimum of effort and the focus has been on providing a solution that can be used with ANY input area.

data.name: Demo_Index_PlugInDemonstrations_ParTwo
data.value: The available demos show the integration of the ACCEPT plug-in with the text editor

data.name: Demo_Index_PlugInDemonstrations_ParTwo_2
data.value: with a configuration for three languages:

data.name: Download_ParagraphOne
data.value: Would you like to make your software work with the ACCEPT Plug-in?

data.name: Download_ParagraphTwo
data.value: Read this documentation to start. The ACCEPT plugin is written in JavaScript and uses the jQuery and jQuery UI libraries. Both are included as part of the download package, but you can always grab the latest version of jQuery core library here and the last version of jQuery UI here. The download package contains all the information needed for the plug-in installation and some additional working examples. Keep in mind that in order to use the ACCEPT plug-in an API key is needed, you can generate one here.

data.value: This DEMO page shows how the Accept Evaluation API can be used to gather feedback. Please note that as part of this DEMO we will also record your Browser type and Browser language when you submit new feedback. To view demo metrics click here.

data.name: Demo_ExplanationText_Par3
data.value: In this demo you have the possibility to change the rules that are used to check your text by selecting an option from the “Rule Set” drop-down list. If you are unsure about the rule set names, you should use the rule set that is selected by default. You also have the possibility to display a “Replace All” button, which will allow you to implement all of the checker’s suggestions automatically. Note that this button will only be displayed when the checker generates some suggestions. Depending on the language or your text, you may also be able to use pre-defined rule sets in a sequential manner.

data.name: ProjectAdminTokenMessage
data.value: To manage your project using the ACCEPT API, the following project token must be provided. This project token is private and you should not share it with anyone.

data.name: UserPrivateKeyBrief
data.value: In order to retrieve your Pre-Editing usage data the below key needs to be provided. Keep in mind the User key is private and you should not share it with anyone. Sharing the private User Key with other entities might compromise any sensitive data.

data.name: TermsAndConditionsMessage
data.value: By clicking the "Register" button and using the ACCEPT Portal, you are entering into a legal agreement and you agree to all of these terms. You also agree to our You also agree to our Privacy Policy, which covers how data is collected, used and stored.

data.name: ErrorPageMessage
data.value: An error occurred while processing your request.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditDisplayTranslationOptions
data.value: Specify whether your users should be able to display alternative options you have included in your project's tasks.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditExternalProject
data.value: Specify whether your post-editing tasks are going to be accessed outside of the Portal.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditInteractiveCheck
data.value: Specify whether your users should be able to check the target text for spelling and grammar.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditInteractiveCheckMetadata
data.value: If applicable, specify the rule set name to use for the interactive check of the target text.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditInvitationBodyText
data.value: Specify custom text to use to invite users to your project.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditMonoOrBilingual
data.value: Specify the default task configuration (Monolingual = no access to source text, Bilingual = access to source text).

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditParaphrasingMetadata
data.value: If applicable, specify the ID of the paraphrasing system to use.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditParaphrasingMode
data.value: Specify whether users should be able to trigger alternative options from a paraphrasing service.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditProjectCommentsDDLOptionsList
data.value: Specify whether a comment drop-down list should be associated with each segment. If so, add any number of options, the first one (usually a question) being displayed to the user by default.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditProjectFinalQuestion
data.value: If required, specify a question the user may have to answer after completing each task.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditProjectSurveyLink
data.value: If you would like users to fill in a post-project questionnaire, specify a valid URL.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditSingleRevisionMaxLockingPeriod
data.value: If your project is collaborative, specify how long a user can work on a task until another user can claim this task. The format is HH:MM:SS, so 00:02:00 is 2 minutes.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditSingleRevisionProject
data.value: If you would like users to work in a collaborative manner on tasks, enable "Collaborative Project". By default, users work on tasks in an independent manner.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditSourceLangId
data.value: Specify the language of the source text.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditTargetLangId
data.value: Specify the language of the target text.

data.name: HelpMessagePostEditUserCanCannotDisplaySource
data.value: Specify whether the user can display or hide the source text (i.e. override the Monolingual/Bilingual setting).

data.name: AvoidDuplicationProjectLevel
data.value: Avoid duplication at the Project level

data.name: AvoidDuplicationTaskLevel
data.value: Avoid duplication at the Task level

data.name: EvaluateOriginalAndAllRevisionsLabel
data.value: Evaluate Original Document and Last (Per Segment) Revisions

data.name: EvaluationAvoidDuplicationsDescriptionLabel
data.value: Specify how you want to handle duplicated segments: Not set (evaluate duplicated segments), task-level (do not evaluate segments that are duplicated at the task level), or project level (do not evaluate segments that are duplicated at the project level).

data.name: EvaluationEmailInvitationDescriptionLabel
data.value: Specify a custom text to include in your invitation email.

data.name: EvaluationIncludeOwnerDescriptionLabel
data.value: Specify whether you want to evaluate the post-editing project owner's revisions.

data.name: EvaluationMethodDescriptionLabel
data.value: Specify the evaluation approach (whether you want to only evaluate the original segments, only the edited segments, or both)

data.name: EvaluationProjectOrganizationDescriptionLabel
data.value: Specify an organization for this project.

data.name: EvaluationFinishedHereLabel
data.value: The Evaluation process is finished here...

data.name: EvaluationInternalProjectDescription
data.value: Specify the post-editing project you want to evaluate.

data.name: MainSlide_1
data.value:
The ACCEPT Portal is an open-source demonstration and experimentation Web application that allows you or your users to perform many content editing and evaluation/rating activities.

These activities can be accessed from the top menu, but some of them involve advanced technical skills, especially if they are to be conducted outside of the Portal using the ACCEPT API.

data.name: MainSlide_2
data.value:
The first activity type concerns Pre-Editing, which allows you or your users to check textual content and improve it based on the spelling, grammar and style feedback received.

From the PreEdit menu, you can either use the demos or generate an application key in order to deploy the Pre-Edit plug-in in your Web environment.

data.name: MainSlide_3
data.value:
The second activity type concerns Post-Editing, which allows you or your users to improve existing (machine-)translated content.

From the PostEdit menu, you can either use the demos or create or access your own projects.

data.name: MainSlide_4
data.value:
The third activity type concerns Evaluation, which allows you or your users to evaluate (machine-)translated content.

From the Evaluate menu, you can either use the demos or create or access your own projects.
